@graph.title: WiMAX technology and network evolution
abstract: Wireless engineers, service designers, product managers, telecommunications professionals, network operators, and academics will all gain new insights into the key issues surrounding the development and implementation of mobile WiMAX. Moreover, the book will help them make informed management and business decisions in devising their own WiMAX strategies

WiMAX Technology and Network Evolution is the first publication to present an accurate, complete, and objective description of mobile WiMAX technology. Each chapter was written and edited by experts, all of whom have been directly engaged in and lead the development of WiMAX either through the IEEE 802.16 Working Group or the WiMAX Forum. As a result, the book addresses not only key technical concepts and design principles, but also a wide range of practical issues concerning this new wireless technology, including

Front Matter -- WiMAX Standardization Overview / Kamran Etemad, Ming-Yee Lai -- Overview of Mobile WiMAX Air Interface in Release 1.0 / Kamran Etemad, Hassan Yaghoobi, Masoud Olfat -- WiMAX Air Interface Enhancements in Release 1.5 / Kamran Etemad, Hassan Yaghoobi -- MIMO Technologies in WiMAX / Qinghua Li, Jianzhong (Charlie) Zhang, Peiying Zhu, Wonil Roh, Xintian Eddie Lin -- Overview of IEEE 802.16m Radio Access Technology / Sassan Ahmadi -- Overview of WiMAX Network Architecture and Evolution / Kamran Etemad, Jicheol Lee, Yong Chang -- Over-the-Air (OTA) Provisioning and Activation / Avishay Shraga -- Mobility in WiMAX Networks / Shahab Sayeedi, Joseph R Schumacher -- WiMAX End-to-End Security Framework / Semyon B Mizikovsky -- Quality of Service (QoS) in WiMAX Networks / Mehdi Alasti, Behnam Neekzad -- Mobile WiMAX Integration with 3GPP and 3GPP2 Networks / Pouya Taaghol, Peretz Feder, Ramana Isukapalli -- Multicast and Broadcast Services in WiMAX Networks / Kamran Etemad, Limei Wang -- Location-Based Services in WiMAX Networks / Wayne Ballantyne, Muthaiah Venkatachalam, Kamran Etemad -- WiMAX Accounting / Avi Lior -- WiMAX Roaming / John Dubois, Chirag Patel -- WiMAX Network Management Framework / Joey Chou -- Ethernet Services In WiMAX Networks / Maximilian Riegel -- WiMAX System Performance / Bong Ho Kim, Jungnam Yun, Yerang Hur -- Femtocells and Multihop Relays in Mobile WiMAX Deployments / Jerry Sydir, Shilpa Talwar, Rakesh Taori, Shu-Ping Y̌h -- WiMAX Spectrum Requirements and Regulatory Landscape / Reza Arefi, Jayne Stancavage -- Index

WiMAX, the Worldwide Interoperability for Microwave Access, represents a paradigm shift in telecommunications technology. It offers the promise of cheaper, smaller, and simpler technology compared to existing broadband options such as DSL, cable, fiber, and 3G wireless
-Emerging broadband services enabled by the WiMAX networks

Kamran Etemad, PhD, is the Director of Technology Standards at Intel Corporation, where he leads many various technical contributions and some of the key strategic and technical initiatives in the WiMAX Forum and IEEE 802.16 and in 3GPP. His research covers such areas as advanced MAC and PHY features for multicarrier and heteronymous radio access networks and system architecture/protocols for enhanced mobility and location and multicast/broadcast services

Ming-Yee Lai, PhD, has more than twenty-five years of experience in telecommunications, networking, and information systems. He currently leads broadband wireless technology development at Telcordia Technologies, Inc. Dr. Lai has championed and been involved in a wide range of WiMAX projects, including WiMAX qualification, performance reconfiguration, priority services, and context aware policy-based resource control. --Book Jacket
-Regulatory issues affecting WiMAX deployment and global adoption
-Detailed description of WiMAX technology features and capabilities from both radio and network perspectives
